meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the children besmutted their clothes with mud.
meanings.sent2: The chimney sweep besmutted his face with soot while cleaning the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy besmutted the entire living room with paw prints.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation was besmutted by false accusations.
meanings.sent5: The storm besmutted the once pristine snow with debris and dirt.

meanings.definition: Covered or stained with soot or dirt.
meanings.sent1: The old book had besmutted pages from years of use.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic's hands were besmutted with grease after fixing the car.
meanings.sent3: The besmutted windows made it difficult to see outside clearly.
meanings.sent4: The besmutted walls of the cave told a story of ancient fires.
meanings.sent5: The besmutted face of the clown added to his mysterious appearance.
